
### position dependence  {.smaller}



* two ways of encoding addresses in x86-64 assembly: 

   * address in little endian (typically 32-bits --- limit on executable size)
   * difference between address and %rip (next instruction address)

 <hr />
 
<code>movb label, %al8a 04 25 \\normalfont{<it></it> label's addr (32 bit)}</code><br />
<code>[\\normalfont{ Intel:} mov AL, [label]]{.my-small}</code><br />
<code>jmp *labelff 24 25 \\normalfont{<it></it> label's addr (32 bit)}</code><br />
<code>[\\normalfont{ Intel:} jmp [label]]{.my-small}</code><br />
<code>movb label(%rip), %al8a 05 \\normalfont{<it> %rip - label's addr (32 bit)</it>}</code><br />
<code>[\\normalfont{ Intel NASM:} mov AL, [REL label]]{.my-small}</code><br />
<code>jmp *label(%rip)e9 \\normalfont{<it> %rip - label's addr (32 bit)</it>}</code><br />
<code>[\\normalfont{ Intel NASM:} jmp [REL label]]{.my-small}</code>
 how to know which? --- check manual
